This email comes directly from my PERSONAL experience and belief as a life-=
time actively practicing Buddhist (not someone who converted in their mid-3=
0s, or just read books on it, etc.etc.)
=C2=A0
=C2=A0 Shinto Deities are Ea=
rthly Gods... they can provide some relative benefit, but cannot bring you =
to your liberation or enlightenment. As such, they cannot be taken as objec=
ts of refuge. However, because of their relative existence as relative gods=
, they can be paid respect to, and thus, shrines within the Temple grounds =
are common for such things.
=C2=A0Even in other countries, like Bhutan or T=
hailand, you will see this respect paid in such a way.=C2=A0=C2=A0 
=C2=A0
=
=C2=A0Within Buddhism --- which actually is a western word.. the real name =
of the religion is simply "The Teachings of Actual Truth as expressed by th=
e Buddhas" .. a.k.a. The Dharma or Buddha Dharma....=C2=A0 
=C2=A0In Buddha=
 Dharma,=C2=A0 you can show respect to any class of sentient being, includi=
ng gods, as long as you don't worship them or take them as your refuge. 
=
=C2=A0
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 So.. paying respect and h=
omage and even making an offering is fine. 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0In this way, "Budd=
hism" does not conflict with most religions, especially religions like shin=
to.=C2=A0 The only religions in conflicts with are the religions were a god=
 demands you take him/her as your sole refuge (most Monotheistic religions)=
.
=C2=A0
=C2=A0Sometimes, earthly gods vow to protect dharma and assist the=
 Sangha...and they become Worldly Protectors.=C2=A0 It is important to note=
 that Worldly Protectors are earth gods associated with Dharma... and that =
"Dharma Protectors" are actually projections/emanations of Buddhas/Bodhisat=
tvas.=C2=A0 Thus, sometimes you see sangha members treating a protector wit=
h refuge, it might look weird. However, if you know they are not a Worldly =
Protector, but a Dharma Protector, then you understand they are paying refu=
ge to a Buddha.=C2=A0 So you need to know if that being is a worldly protec=
tor or a dharma protector. 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 In the ea=
rlier letter, it sounded like he (Eddie?)=C2=A0was saying that Buddha's God=
 was Amida ? Maybe I read that wrong-- but let me just correct this just in=
 case.
=C2=A0 
=C2=A0 Buddha has no god. This is because Dharma teaches two=
 realities 1.) relative and 2.) Absolute.
=C2=A0
=C2=A0The=C2=A0 relative r=
eality is "run" by Interdependet Origination, which manifest as different t=
ypes of karma (Yes.. there are actually different types of karma, not just =
"karma"). This system is, in a nutshell, a system of cause-and-result. 
=C2=
=A0
=C2=A0The absolute truth is the buddhanature a.k.a. nature of mind etc.=
etc... 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0 At no point in this equation is there a "god".=C2=A0=
=C2=A0 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0Amida, better known as Amitabha or Amitayus (Infinite =
Light) (Infinite Life)... is the Buddha who radiates the "western paradise"=
..=C2=A0=C2=A0 which, in all seriousness, is like a world that was purified=
 due to Amitabha's enligthenment.=C2=A0 
=C2=A0 How did this happen ?
=C2=
=A0=C2=A0 Because of Interdependent Origination.
=C2=A0
=C2=A0Amitabha made=
 a series of vows and those vows were interdependent with his awakening. As=
 he awoke, these vows ripened.=C2=A0 Most Buddhas have some kind of "relate=
d power".. that upon awakening, their vow ripens into that power ...so to s=
peak.=C2=A0 Amitabha vowed that his awakening would be interconnected with =
the pufication of the world he was practicing on, and that once he attained=
 enlightenment, his radiance would produce this pure field. 
=C2=A0=C2=A0 A=
nother vow that was ripened was that if you focus on Amitabha PROPERLY, you=
 can connect with his radiance from your concentration meeting with his rip=
ened vow. 
=C2=A0 
=C2=A0 O.k... many people have seemingly misunderstood h=
ow this works. Most Amitabha practice was become really just Buddha-Christ=
=C2=A0 god-worshiping and "save me Oh Amida!" kinda of methodology.
=C2=A0
=
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 The real idea is that you take Amitabha, the Pure Land, =
His vows..etc.etc.. AS YOUR OBJECT OF CONCENTRATION... and through the proc=
ess of meditating and concentrating on these, you will create the connectio=
n with it. 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0 It is actually suppose to be a form of meditation=
... not salvation worship.=C2=A0 However, as most of the common folk, such =
as farmers and merchents, don't have time, leisure, or training on how to p=
roperly concentrate on an object or to meditate, the system of "Amida's sal=
vation if you call out to him" came into effect...
=C2=A0
=C2=A0because, if=
 their faith in Amitabha can be sustain in their mind, they will KEEP Amita=
bha in their thoughts constantly...
=C2=A0
=C2=A0.. then this MIGHT produce=
 the same result as if you were properly meditating on Amitabha.
=C2=A0
=C2=
=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 However, this must be understood to be an=
 alteration to the actual program/system of accomplishing the Pure Land. 
=
=C2=A0
=C2=A0
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 =
Amitabha was never taught, by the Buddhas, to be a "god" or a "savior" --- =
He is a meditation technique, actually.=C2=A0 All four variations of the Pu=
re Land sutra teach this, and in the esoteric Amitabha rituals teach this a=
s well.=C2=A0 
=C2=A0=C2=A0 In this case :=C2=A0=C2=A0 "Faith" =3D "Mental =
Concentration"
=C2=A0
=C2=A0 It should be noted that one can make contact, =
in theory, with ANY Buddha or Bodhisattva via this method of mental concent=
ration, not just Amitabha.=C2=A0 The "key difference" of Amitabha is the be=
ing born into the Pure Field part. 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0I hope this puts this into proper=
 perspective.
